frameDefinitions: A Speaker states or makes known a future Eventuality on the basis of some Evidence.
A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
An Agent acts in a certain Manner either generally or under some particular Circumstances.
A Performer has a certain Role in a Performance and plays their part by following the directions in the Script for that particular Role.
An Entity is designed for or exists to perform an Activity or fulfill a Role. ''
frameExamples: The Weather Centre <t>predicted</t> that it would be warmer but wet for the weekend.
Let's hope it did n't have time to <t>communicate</t> any of its findings to its overlords.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
He pledges to  <t>conduct</t> himself  with honesty and humility.
Margaret Thatcher <t>played</t> Juliet in a school play.
This platform will <t>serve</t> as a great stage for tomorrow's play.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a prediction.

This role marks expressions that indicate an event or state that is predicted to occur or hold at a future time. A single <fen>Eventuality</fen> may be expressed discontinuously in a raising construction. This role is also used for expressions that denote entities with variable attributes about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes predictions.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the prediction.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the prediction pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <m>about</m>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the prediction is made.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the prediction.
The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The location where the act of communication occurs.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
This role marks expressions that denote the person whose conduct is being evaluated.
This role marks expressions that characterize the way that the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves in a certain way.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> exhibits their behavior.
The <fen>Audience</fen> experiences the <fen>Performance</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Performer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Performance</fen> to the <fen>Audience</fen>.
The <fen>Performer</fen>s generates the <fen>Performance</fen> which  the <fen>Audience</fen> perceives.
The <fen>Performer</fen> provides an experience for the <fen>Audience</fen>.
The music which may be performed in the <fen>Performance</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.

The (usually written) directions which instruct the <fen>Performer</fen>s on what actions to perform, when, and how.  It has many different names depending on the <fen>Type</fen> of <fen>Performance</fen> including <ment>script</ment>, <ment>screenplay</ment>, <ment>libretto</ment>, <ment>book</ment>, and <ment>choreography</ment>.
This role indicates the subtype of <fen>Performance</fen>, including <ment>dance</ment>, <ment>theater</ment>, <ment>film</ment>, etc.

<fen>Role</fen> identifies one of the possible relations that the <fen>Performer</fen> can have to the <fen>Performance</fen>.  The <fen>Role</fen> (s) a <fen>Performer</fen> has in the <fen>Performance</fen> will determine which parts of the <fen>Script</fen> should be performed by the <fen>Performer</fen>, as the <fen>Script</fen> is written in terms of which <fen>Role</fen> (s) each set of instructions applies to.  In the fields of theater, movies, ballet, and opera, a <fen>Role</fen> generally corresponds to a character in the story of the <fen>Script</fen>, while other types of performance may use more general <fen>Role</fen>s like <ment>lead violinist</ment>.
The person that performs alongside Performer2.
The person that is also in the Performance, alongside Performer1.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> an event occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is an object or person that performs the <fen>Activity</fen> or fulfills the <fen>Role</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> is the action that the <fen>Entity</fen> performs.
The <fen>Role</fen> is  the position or duty that is occupied by the <fen>Entity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The institute</fex> forecast an increase in leisure spending of 15 per cent.
The events that would occur over the next several years had been predicted <fex>in the Bible</fex>.
John predicted <fex>last year</fex> that he would be finished by October.
Greenman predicted <fex>at a small dinner party</fex> that the market would rise again.
<fex>He</fex> finds it hard to communicate with people, not least his separated parents .
How do you communicate to them <fex>that you really like them</fex> ?
Had someone communicated to the capital <fex>about the flagrant disregard of the religious law</fex> ?
Opinions are usually communicated <fex>over the telephone</fex> and are often given within 24 hours.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
They stood together and posed for the pass, Alleyne relaxed and smiling , a tall , angular man who carried himself <fex>with natural elegance</fex> .
She knew that she had behaved badly <fex>last night</fex>

Sometimes an offender may be placed at a Probation hostel because they have committed
a serious offence or have behaved badly <fex>at an independent hostel</fex>
He co-starred <fex>with Matt Perry</fex> in Tool 3.
Who co-starred <fex>with Glen Close</fex> in that space opera thingy?
